Description: Several fragments of a brown, dark brown and natural-coloured wool mantle. The weave is plain and weft-predominant. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's'. The thread count is warp 6 per 10mm and weft 12 and 20 per 10mm. The selvedge is reinforced with 2 and 3 warp cords and the edges are 's'-cord. There are natural coloured bands at either end and alternating bands of brown and dark brown in the centre. Selvedge patterns are present at both edges and consist of blue triangles edged in natural colour, with a natural coloured tassel, embroidered on a dark brown background.
Dimensions: Width: 110 millimetres (brown and dark brown bands, maximum.)
Width: 60 millimetres (brown and dark brown bands, minimum)
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 65, fig. 10c)
Condition: Fair. Several loose threads on the back.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.238B (excavation object cat. no.)
